Question
========

Suppose a class contains 40 students. Of these, 3 students are left-handed. The teacher happens to have chosen a lefty to answer the first question. For the next question, the teacher chooses a different student. What is then the probability that the teacher will again choose a left-hander to answer the next question?

Answerlist
----------

* 3/40
* 2/39
* 2/43
* 6/1560

Solution
========

Answerlist
----------

* 3/40: Incorrect
* 2/39: Correct
* 2/43: Incorrect
* 6/1560: Incorrect
